result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:33 PM Defendant Noah W Garland in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson via phone.  Defendant Noah W Garland in custody.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch requests $5000 cash bond on 19CF176 and $2500 cash bond on 22CF6 and gives argument for request. Atty Helgeson requests a signature bond on each case.  Court orders $2000 cash bond in 19CF176 and $2000 cash bond in 22CF6. Cases are set for sentencing on 7/28. 2:40

10:30 AM Defendant Noah W Garland does not appear in Court, Atty Philip A. Helgeson, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 19CF176 (SEH) and 22CF6 (PleaH). Court notes DE sent a request to reset because he has covid. DA Hatch states DE appeared in SCC 7/5/22 and is requesting the warrant be executed. Atty Helgeson does not have any additional information. Court will issue the warrant that was authorized. Atty Helgeson to contact DE and if the Court receives information of positive covid test Court will consider quashing the warrant. Attorneys would like to the SEH/PleaH.  Court ajourned at 10:37 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:33 PM Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 19CF176 and 22CF6 heard at this time. Court notes Defendant sent a fax stating he was exposed to COVID and couldn't get a ride. DA Hatch requests a warrant on each cases; adjoining states. Atty Helgeson: received the same message; has met with the client prior to today. Court: Defendant failed to make the necessary appointments for the PSI, authorizes a warrant, but stays until July 7, 2022.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:31 AM Defendant Noah W Garland appears from Jai in person, Atty Philip A. Helgeson, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Sgt Kevin Moore. S/T. DA Hatch questions Sgt Moore. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Helgeson.  DA Hatch is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. 3:51 PM Defendant Noah W Garland appears in court in custody, via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.
